name: Icinga Dark
description: Dark theme for Icinga2 users. Are you doing the daily server monitoring at late night or have Icinga on big TV in your office? This theme is carefully crafted just for you! Just choose a scheme you want (under the Customize Settings) and click Install.

user.name: dehahost
user.about:
dehahost loves to make thinkgs look better and/or different than original.

His motto is: "Nothing is impossible!" - Shia LaBeouf.

additional_info:
Brief changelog
Version 8 - rel. 2020/02/16
  • Bugfixes, bugfixes, bugfixes.
  • New Icinga 2.7's UI controls class is fully themed.
  • Want to look under the lid? Visit GitHub repo ;-)
Version 7 - rel. 2019/11/24
  • Whole CSS was rewritten to support color schemes.
  • Gruvbox is a first real dark scheme to try, use and love.
  • Reimplemented Black scheme. Also a few necessary modifications was made.
  • So choose a scheme! :-) Dark (default option) and Gruvbox. More schemes are comming. ;-)
  • Firefox users can enjoy colored scroll bars.
Version 6 - rel. 2019/10/25
  • Introduced Icinga Web 2 auto-detection using RegExp
  • Improved styling for 2.6.3
  • Popup menus have transparency
  • Active items are more darker (to be more OLED friendly)
  • Custom color scheme will be thinked out.
Version 5 - rel. 2019/03/20
  • Darkness swallowed the login screen.
  • Fix for inputboxes
Version 4 - rel. 2019/03/11
  • Latest version of Icinga is looking great with this style!
  • Added style for pre element.
  • Added style for menu toggle button.
  • Added style for menu sidepanel (background and shadow).
  • Fixed some whites on hover... :-)
Version 3 - rel. 2018/11/29
  • Textareas have now black text. I forgot.
  • Fixed background color in dashboard settings. It's now more black than before!
  • Fixed foreground color filter search input.
  • Active stage of search box (under the Icinga2 logo) have same style as active menu item.
Version 2 - rel. 2018/11/29
  • Fixed input form components. Like text input.
Version 1 - rel. in 2018/10
  • Vibrant colors that works - distinct what is critical, warning or just OK.
  • Really pure black background color - #000.

discussions.name: Thanks. Would be great to have more colors!
